Description: Sherd of rim of North Ionian black-figured pottery large bowl; interior glazed with added red band near lip and added white circle and other traces below; exterior: short verticals at rim above band; in frieze below, black-figure sphinx to left, with red hair and wing details.
Curator's comments: The inside decoration is probably not an inscription in view of the broad diagonal ghost of a perhaps red design to left of the circle.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.236)
